page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The village of Belper, known as{De {Bradelie}in the Domesday Book and in 1264 as{Beaurepaire}probably stood around the Market Place Close by is Belper's oldest building {St John's Church}now 714 years old. Several{nail shops}remind us of Belper's earliest famous{nail industry and its local history. In old Belper, too, is evidence of a "new way of life", which centered around the {Strutt's cotton mills}along the River Derwent. Cottages and{cobbled streets built 1785_1790 form a conservation area . The Strutt family gave Belper many fine buildings including the {Workhouse,}now{Babington Hospital. Underneath the box pews of The {Unitarian Chapel}lies the{Strutt {family's catacomb.
